Package edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_tasks.model.tasks

Class Task

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_tasks.model.tasks.Task
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable
    public class Task
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    Constructs and controls the Task object with methods. Each task has a field of a name, description, and whether the task is recurring and/or active. Each task also has a field of type iSwapList called taskList and has functionality to get and add a taskList of type AbstractTaskList. Recurring tasks are cloned when marked as completed through the clone() method. Class implements the Cloneable interface.
    Author:
    Anika Bhadriraju

    • Constructor Detail

      • Task

        public Task​(java.lang.String taskName,
            java.lang.String taskDetails,
            boolean recurring,
            boolean active)
        Constructs a Task from the provided task name, description, and whether the task is active and/or recurring. Also constructs the taskList field to an empty SwapList of AbstractTaskLists. The setting of the fields of the task is delegated to the public setter helper methods.
        Parameters:
        taskName - name of Task
        taskDetails - details/description of Task
        recurring - true if the task is recurring
        active - true if the task is active

    • Method Detail

        public void setTaskName​(java.lang.String taskName)
        Sets the task's name. The task's name cannot be null or empty.
        Parameters:
        taskName - task name to set
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if task name is null or an empty string

      • getTaskListName

        public java.lang.String getTaskListName()
        Returns the name of the task list that the task is in. If taskLists is null or empty, an empty string is returned. If there are multiple AbstractTaskLists in the taskLists field, the name of the first task list is returned.
        Returns:
        name of task list

      • addTaskList

        public void addTaskList​(AbstractTaskList taskList)
        Adds the AbstactTaskList is added to end of the taskLists field unless the AbstractTaskList is already registered with the Task. Functionality of the taskLists AbstractTaskList is delegated to the AbstractTaskList java class.
        Parameters:
        taskList - AbstractTaskList to add to the end of the taskLists field
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the taskList parameter is null

      • completeTask

        public void completeTask()
        Marks the Task as complete and notifies the corresponding taskLists through the completeTask() method in the TaskList class. If the Task is recurring, the task is cloned through the clone() method in Task and added to the AbstractTaskList that is registered.
        Throws:
        java.lang.CloneNotSupportedException - if there are no AbstractTaskLists registered with the task

      • clone

        public java.lang.Object clone()
                       throws java.lang.CloneNotSupportedException
        Creates a new task with copies of the fields. This new task is returned with a new SwapList in the taskLists fields to avoid references to the sane AbstractTaskList objects.
        Returns:
        copy of the current task
        Throws:
        java.lang.CloneNotSupportedException - if there are no AbstractTaskLists registered with the task

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of all Task fields. Overridden to create specific output for writing Task information to a file.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String representation of Issue
